Reviews.Title: “No other competion needed”
Reviews.Author: Tanderra77
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the savoy, a boutique hotel staff wonderful, always helpful and a ready smile each time I'd pass them. Double bay is gorgeous, most people very nice, except the more pricey clothing stores, god forbid you even look at any of their things let alone touch them. Savoy is right in the centre of everything and within walking distance of all that interested us, very clean and although may need some upgrading I liked the oldness, gave it character. AT first I thought being the only hotel in double bay we'd be treated like outcasts. They treated us great I couldn't have asked for better. Accommodation , if another hotel does open up there I'd still. Choose the savoy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DurhamJeb
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay spread over ten years and each time we have upgraded.This time we booked an executive room( on the top floor|) and balcony with just a glimpse of the harbour r(not quite the opera house) The hotel's location in Double Bay is its best selling point with its smart shops; range of cafes/restaurants and excellent transport links. However we have always found the staff friendly and rooms well serviced,although a cloth to dry dishes would be helpful. We accept that some aspects of furnishings have been there a while but had no complaints about our room and since our last visit improvements have taken place in the first floor lounge and the breakfast cafe has been relocated on the ground floor offering ready access to the public. On balance we still believe the Savoy is value for money and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The management of this hotel is guilty of mis-representation!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel4748
Reviews.Content: The main Knox Street entrance features a display claiming the Savoy to be a boutique hotel for discerning travellers. The website describes it as like a private club and a home away from home. However, the rooms were basic and run-down in every possible way. The twin room I stayed in with my daughter had beds made up with sheets and duvets but no duvet covers. I queried this with the receptionist 1) on the grounds of hygiene 2) mis-representation of photographs on both the hotel and tripadvisor websites. She told me it was management policy not to use duvet covers on any beds in any rooms. The furniture and furnishings were low-quality eg unmatched beds, bedside cabinets, wardrobe and fridge cupboard. Everything was random, seedy and the thin carpet was sticky. This supposedly Superior room, as opposed to Standard, was described as looking into a courtyard, which was actually a dark space next to a store room. The room smelled of poor drainage and damp. I queried this with the receptionist who said it is a problem of this type of inner room which is difficult to ventilate and keep aired. She would ask the cleaners to attend to it the next day. Their solution was to leave on the bathroom wall heater ALL DAY so that the room was unbearably hot when we returned that summer's evening. The painted walls and doors were grubby and chipped. The shower room was very small and run-down eg old, cracked tiles, no drain cover in the basin and fixed wall soap dispensers which reminded me of a public toilet rather than a boutique hotel. I could go on to describe the cockroaches in the second floor seating guest area and my conversation with the receptionist, which was reminiscent of an episode of Fawlty Towers but I will stop there! Overall, nothing was 'boutique' or likely to satisfy a discerning traveller. I agree the room price I paid, AU$135 for Wednesday/Thursday and AU$145 for Friday/ Saturday, was less than many CDB hotels. Also, Double Bay is a delightful location with much to recommend it. However, neither of these excuse seedy, run-down, basic rooms mis-represented as 4**** standard. I have stayed in many Backpacker hostels with no pretentions of grandeur but better rooms than this so-called boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Neat, Nice, OK”
Reviews.Author: Emeste22
Reviews.Content: The Savoy's best asset is its location. Set in smart Double Bay, there's scope for lots of exploring around interesting streets, shops and restaurants. Nevertheless, for first time visitors to Sydney, perhaps a CBD hotel is more convenient. The Savoy is clean, functional and comfortable. The rooms vary in standard - mine was quite spacious with a comfortable bed, sofa and desk. The furnishings were a little worn (tired) and the room needs a general refreshening. The broken lights in the bathroom were fixed promptly once reported. Pleasant service with basic dining and refreshment areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great option if you are on a budget but want to be well located”
Reviews.Author: Graham W
Reviews.Content: Double Bay is a delightful upmarket suburb of the city and this hotel is just two blocks from the ocean and the ferry dock that takes you to Circular Quay (just 9 minutes on the fast service). You are near an array of beaches with Bondi a short bus journey away. Other buses pass nearby that will take you in to the city centre or you can take the ferry to Circular Quay and on to all the other main points in the city. The hotel is simple and a bit kitch in some aspects, but spotlessly clean and with exceptionally helpful and friendly staff. It is actually a bit of a lost opportunity, as it could be a really exceptional property, but then it would loose its charm and for sure be double the price. They are great coffee shops and restaurants nearby. Don't miss Indigo for breakfast, lunch or brunch. A place to sit and enjoy people watching. This hotel is a fantastic option if you are on a limited budget, want to have easy and quick access to all the main points of the city, and to stay in a charming neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Some things great, some things not-so-great”
Reviews.Author: thetravelingtrio3
Reviews.Content: First, the guy at the front desk was awesome! So friendly and helpful, I couldn't speak highly enough of him. Secondly, the position was incredible. Right in the heart of gorgeous Double Bay, with cafes, shops, a walk to Edgecliff station and an even easier walk to the Ferry docks. Two options for getting into the city (downtown Sydney) in a matter of minutes. The ferry is by far the more beautiful travel choice! The figs and surrounding houses and building are gorgeous and show off some of the best that Sydney has to offer. The room was small-average sized hotel room, the bedding was clean. We had a child with us and used the fold out couch as abed as well as the queen bed. With the fold-out opened and made-up there was hardly any room to move about - beware! There was a small table and 2 chairs that were able to be used and a small bar fridge, which were nice convieniences. Another great feature was that the fold-out was made up and out when we arrived, which was a great touch. Too often they know you will be using the fold out couch, and when you arrive you have to open it up yourself and deal with all the cushions - or worse, open it up and make it up yourself! The savoy is clearly good at customer service as this was all done in anticipation of our arrival - thank you Savoy. The bathroom had some newer touches - the vanity and sink looked new, but the tile and shower did not. Some mould and mildew, throughout the shower and floors and a build up of dirt and dust in the corners of the bathroom, the bathroom door had cracks in it and was water-warped. One of the days we were there the floor drain had some kind of terrible smell coming from it. It dissipated by the next morning. The bathroom was VERY small and the letdown of the room. Though the room was definitely on the older side, it all seemed very clean and well-looked after. Sadly, the bathroom let the whole room down. If they could renovate this to a cleaner, newer look, I would rave about this hotel. All in all, the hotel provided for our needs, and at a reasonable price (about $130/night I think). We only used parking for one night ($15/night) as there was street parking that was able to be utilized as long as you were prepared to move your car around after your few hours were up. They did have an economical breakfast option also, that we didn't take advantage of. I would visit again if it were just for a night, but if staying a few nights like we did for 3 of us, it was a little small and the bathroom not clean enough. If they fixed the bathroom situation, I would stay here everytime I was in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for us.”
Reviews.Author: kez93
Reviews.Content: The Savoy ticked all our boxes for our breif stay in Sydney and the location/ price would be hard to beat hence my daughter and I are staying for a week next year. The decor is a little tired but the price is comensurate with that. The ferry is a short walk, and there are plenty of restaurants and shops literally at the door step. The room was clean and had everything we needed. I would rather stay in Double Bay than be amongst the hussle and bussle of central Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with a Water Glimpse”
Reviews.Author: LAL888
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in an Executive Balcony room; the room was large and the balcony with the glimpse of Double Bay was great. I think the price (under $200) and location make it great value. Personally I prefer staying in the suburbs like Double Bay than Darling Harbor of Circular Quay. The restaurants and shopping are tops. Edgecliff station is close by and Bondi Junction is a 10 min taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Eastern Suburbs base”
Reviews.Author: Montezoomer
Reviews.Content: This small centrally located hotel ticked all the boxes for us. The suite, although small, easily accommodated a couple and our adult daughter. The staff were obliging and helpful. What really appeals about the Savoy is the quiet, central location at such a reasonable tariff, in the heart of Double Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely area!”
Reviews.Author: Scotrocker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights over New Year after finding an unbelievable deal on a website. The hotel isn't right in the centre of Sydney but is easily commutable with thr trains, buses and boats which run from the area! There are lots of lovely little shops and restaurants nearby in the hotel too which made this a lovely area to stay in. You get the impression that the area is really upmarket. The hotel room was a little bit small but clean and with good facilities. There is a cafe attached to the hotel which does a great breakfast, but with all the nearby restaurants and cafes you wouldn't be stuck anyway! Great hotel , especially for the price (we found out on checking out the hotel had actually advertised it over the New Year weekend at the wrong price but as we'd booked it in good faith, decided to honour the incorrect (and greatly reduced) price!) Nice change of pace from the hustle and bustle of the centre of Sydney and with excellent public transport getting to see the sights was not a problem!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but cheaper than the rest”
Reviews.Author: BarrieS2
Reviews.Content: The way i look at it is if you're in Sydney and you're looking for a cheap hotel then this is for you. You get a half decent breakfast and a good nights sleep and shower. Its not that close to the city centre but taxis and buses are no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: christvr
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive of staying here after reading several reviews. I must say that I am here now and find them to be untrue. Of course I did not have one of the rooms without windows. Mine was clean and on the top floor w/ balcony. One of the only ones. The room was clean and the service was quick and friendly. I recommend having the breakfast buffet in the downstairs restaurant. $6.50 a day and that is a steal compared to other area restaurants. beautiful area

Reviews.Title: “Central to all of Double Bay's finest - spotlessly clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: The_Blonde_Beach
Reviews.Content: My husband Ian and I are frequent travellers to Sydney and we always stay at The Savoy. Why? Katrina, Patrick, Tommy, Brita and Amy are like family to us and take very good care of us. The rooms are a bit run down and worn, but oh so clean. Double Bay is one of the most expensive suburbs in Sydney yet this hotel's rates remain low, even though two other hotels have since closed down (Ritz Carlton & The Sir Stamford). The rooms are on average only about $135 per night - year round! How can you argue with that? The beds are comfy as all hotel beds should be. If you want 5 star, then be sure to request the rooms on the 4th floor, both are the newest and most glamorous. They have large balconies and outdoor settings for two and views! The decor of these two rooms is lovely - black and white - my favourite!! The bathrooms are sparkling. The rooms are equipped with wide screen televisions, air-con, fridges, kettle/tea/coffee etc. This hotel is within easy walking distance to everything. When in Sydney, we wouldn't stay anywhere else. We are world travellers and have stayed in hotels with ratings from 2 stars to 7 stars. We could stay at more expensive lodgings, but we don't want to! Also, our favourite restaurant is close by (The 18 Footer's yacht club). We love Double Bay and we ADORE the Savoy. Don't take my word for it - go see for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: downundergirl01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Savoy for a course being held there. We had a great stay and it lived up to the friendliness and atmosphere of a smaller establishment. Room was basic and dated but the cleanliness and the comfortable beds were great which are the most imporant things to me. The airconditioning was good and nice to be able to get fresh air via opening windows (becoming a rarity in hotels these days). The staff were friendly and helpful especially for the course and the room there was always clean. The sitting area with the free coffee and tea was a bonus. Being close to the harbour, shops and restaurants was wonderful and preferable to a multi storey impersonal hotel in the city. Found the other reviews as I was recommending to a family member requiring value for money accommodation for an upcoming visit. Not sure why some of the other reviews were so negative. My standards are definitely very high but realistic too. It is well within its star rating and a little gem that I would come back to on another visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Naturemurph
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Savoy Double Bay Hotel and were glad to leave. Our room had no exterior windows, and the windows that faced the hallway had broken blinds that didn't close all the way. The only way to insure privacy was to close the heavy curtains which made the room feel extremely claustrophobic. Also, the common areas of the hotel were dingy and not very clean and there were tacky Christmas decorations and blinking Christmas lights that shone into our room. They charged for access to wireless internet. We were on a limited budget, but still were pretty disappointed. I've stayed in nicer hostels.

Reviews.Title: “To be frank it reminded me of Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: MJ_Lowson
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a group of 60 from Sheffield and Nottingham for the World Youth Day Celebrations in Sydney and when we arrived, I always felt that we were an inconvenience. The Hotel was in a beautiful spot. Double Bay is one of the nicest places I've visited but we arrived tired and ready for a meal. (We'd travelled from Melbourne at 5am that morning) The managaress was one of the rudest women I have ever met. In the quiet lounge area we saw a sign saying that it must be vacated by 10pm - since rooms are within very close distance. We didnt find that a problem until the manageress who clearly didnt think much of a group of Poms staying over said, "Its 10 so Shift". In the hotel the room was a high point very spacious and with a proper table. But other than that and the location in Double Bay the Savoy was a grave disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recommend this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: traveller_WA04
Reviews.Content: I have visited Sydney many times over the years and stayed at a variety of accommodation types and locations to suit the occasion (Olympic Games, family Christening, friend's 40th, business, family holiday). I chose the Savoy Hotel for my recent visit due to its location in Double Bay, as it is very close to the function I was attending. Unfortunately, I will not be recommending it to anyone. On arrival late in the day, I was allocated a room which on entry smelled of paint. Despite opening the window, the strong smell persisted and was so overbearing that I was unable to have a decent night's sleep. I think the paint fumes were coming from newly painted tiles in the bathroom. The room was described as Superior which is a gross misrepresentation. The room was extremely small, the decor was dated, walls chipped, TV at least 20 years old and there was a large hole in the blanket on my bed. The next day I asked to be moved and without any apology at all, was given the key to another room. One of the staff members on reception was helpful, the other completely rude. The room I moved to was just as jaded as the previous room though fortunately there was no smell of paint fumes. Judging by the other reviews on this website, it appears that the hotel has gone downhill rapidly in the past couple of years. The hotel is described as 3 star but I would suggest that a 2 star rating would be more accurate. Unfortunately with the closure of the Sir Stamford hotel across the road, there is little choice of accommodation in this lovely part of Sydney so The Savoy no longer needs to be competitive with service. In future, I will be consulting this website more thoroughly before booking a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely comfortable little hotel in my favourite area of Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne Howker
Reviews.Content: The Savoy is a wonderful little hotel and superb value in an expensive beautiful relaxed city which just happens to be my own original home town and my favourite area of Sydney, Double Bay. If you are used to a European lifestyle then Double Bay is full of leafy streets, cafes for people watching, lovely restaurants with top quality cuisine, upmarket fashion boutiques and a short stroll down to the ferry and harbour view with a little beach and park. It is the beginning of the wealthiest part of Sydney and buses about two minutes walk from the hotel which is set in a quiet little fashion arcade will take you to the lovely beach and restaurants at Watsons Bay, Rose Bay, the parklands of Nielsen Park, and a quick trip to Bondi, to Potts Point and the city area or there is the nearby train station at Edgecliff and then near the station the beautiful yachting harbourside area near Darling Point at the lovely leafy Rushcutter's Bay Park. and also a short walk nearby to the lovely area of Elizabeth Bay. The hotel is comfortable and spotlessly clean. The Managers, Patrick and Katrina will look after you as if you are family, assisted by Britta, Joanne and Amy, everyone is willing to help you in any way they can. Tea and coffee are available in your room and in the lounge area with all the leaflets you could ever need to assist you in your enjoyment of Sydney. The bus from the main street in Double Bay just outside Woolworths will take you to the Quay where you can board a ferry to the beautiful area of Manly Beach, to Balmoral Beach and its restaurants via Mosman, to a beautiful harbourside walk at Cremorne, or to the Zoo which is I think the best in the world with panoramic views of Sydney Harbour. The Quay itself is lined with some of the best harbourside restaurants in the world. A short taxi ride will take you to the lovely restaurants and boutiques in Paddington and Woollahra. The Savoy is quiet and safe, it is not one of the high priced glamorous hotels but you can enjoy lunches and dinners at those hotels and come home to your lovely little room at Double Bay. I cannot recommend this too highly. I have stayed here for a month with my husband four years ago and again for a month on my own last year. My husband is enjoying ten days there at the moment and I hope to return for a month again myself in November. I cannot recommend the hotel and the area too highly if you want a carefree happy time in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not the Ritz but a decent value!”
Reviews.Author: patrema
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this older hotel for five days during our visit to Sydney. A big plus is that itâ€™s not terribly expensive in a city that is. Itâ€™s located on a pretty tree-lined street in the Double Bay neighborhood. It was fun getting the nearby ferry for a quick trip to Circular Quay every day. The front desk staff was reasonably helpful, and the breakfast was a very good buy. Unlike a few other reviewers, we found the hotel to be clean (or we wouldn't have stayed) although definitely needing an update. I understand from reading here on Trip Advisor that some renovations are now being made. If youâ€™re looking for a modern, glitzy hotel, this is not it, but, as I said, this is reflected in the lower prices. If we were to return to Sydney, we would probably select this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: heathersspam
Reviews.Content: We were there for 6 days. THe hotel is nice and the staff is friendly. The halls are not air conditioned and very humid, (coming from southern california that is unusual, but over there that seemed pretty normal). The rooms are clean and basic, no view are any frills. There is a laundrymat there which was really nice. The hotel is near a lot of shops and restaurants. There are some EXCELLENT pastry/coffee houses nearby. And RedLeaf Pool is within walking distance (It is a fenced in part of the bay where only the locals go- very nice) FYI: If you stay here, do not rent a car. It was more of a liability than a convenience. There is no parking and the hotel down the street that shares a parking lot with Savoy but the cost is outrageous. I suggest renting a car for only the days when you plan on leaving the Sydney area and not the whole time. The bus system there was terrific. We visited the Royal Park and the Blue Mountains which are about 1 hours drive from the city, very pretty, but we definitely didn't need the car for 6 days.

Reviews.Title: “Room Selection A Must.”
Reviews.Author: Clive16
Reviews.Content: After checking the hotel website, booked a Superior Room, which on arrival in our opinion proved to be anything but. The room was looking tired with dowdy colours and needing a revamp. The next day we reviewed both the executive rooms and the suite, which have recently been completely refurbished and it was like being in a different property. We upgraded to the executieve room for a reasonable extra cost, and the remaining eleven days were a pleasure as this room had flat screen TV, a private large balcony with a distant view of part of Double Bay. I would strongly suggest using the ferry into Circular Quay, providing you get the timetable first. Usually two ferries an hour, always running to time, and a brisk eight minute walk from the hotel. The buses which stop nearby are fairly erratic in their timings. Waits of 20-30 minutes not uncommon. Breakfast is good value ( extra for the full works ), and the area has a good range of restaurants close by. Staff were helpful and courteous. I would class this as a three star hotel in an area where hotels are not that plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly place”
Reviews.Author: Phill_Chris
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location in Double Bay, Sydney. It is just a couple of bays down from Central Quay. Central Sydney is easily reached by bus or ferry. The ferry is 5-10mins walk from the hotel, the bus even less. Double Bay itself is a wealthy area with a nice little beach, lots of pavement cafes, bars, restaurants and designer shops. The Golden Sheaf "Hotel" (pub) is very lively with live music most nights, good food and a very lively young atmosphere not typical of the area. The Savoy is a little unusual. It is on the first/second floor of a shopping mall. It consists of a number of interconnected areas with different types of rooms. We were in the "retreat" where we had a large, comfortable room with a large balcony. The hotel was very clean and well cared for with a lot of homely touches. The staff were very friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble and they loved to chat. A good sign was that they appeared to have quite a few regular visitors. The hotel was quiet and even though we overlooked the main street we were not distrurbed by noise. There was no restaurant in the hotel although this wasn't a problem given the range and quality of food available within a few hundred yards. Breakfast was provided in a small cafe on the ground floor. This provided a good breakfast of cereal, toast and plenty of fresh fruit. A cooked breakfast could be obtained at an extra cost. In conclusioin a small. comfortable, friendly, slightly quirky hotel in an excellent location which would suite anyone not looking for the city centre, big chain corporate hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: gary26
Reviews.Content: Ok, so the Savoy may not be the best Hotel, but for the price staying over the New Year period is was excellent value. The rooms do need re decorating, but during the time of our stay, the upper floors were being done. Clean Yes, maid service daily, great location for cafes,a couple of dollars for a bus into the city. Value for money 8 out of 10. I'd like to see it when all the rooms have been finsihed. You cannot compare the Savoy with The Stamford....two totally different priced hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Look eslewhere for a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: homecoming
Reviews.Content: We booked for 4 nights in a Family Interconnect suite as we had 2 children with us, with the plan to move to a small room for another 7 days for my husband and I after the children left. The upside - the Savoy is small, cozy and in a great location. Breakfast was good - fresh fruit, cereal, toast, juice - how do they do it so cheaply - it's great. Downside - the hotel is in dire need of TLC and basic maintenance. The door to our room didn't lock (apparently there was a trick to it, we were told when we informed front desk. Suggestion - maybe tell the guests first? Or maybe fix it?) The a/c will freeze you and rattle scarily and when we reported that we were told it should stop after 5 or 10 mins. Again, how about fixing it? It wouldn't be possible to sleep with that noise. Broken window slats, rusty fridges and in one room the smell was so awful I felt sad for previous occupants who put up with it. The thing that got me moving to the checkout 7 days early was the lack of cleanliness and lack of care about it. At dinner in the atrium area, we'd dropped some food and didn't realise until we moved away from the table and saw 6 massive cockies having a feast. The little cockroach in the kitchen was having a good time too, same couldn't be said for the big squashed one right outside our door. After 2 trips to the front desk about it, no action, no care. Glasses unwashed in our room, never enough towels supplied, strangely changed stories about whether we could get a refund upon early checkout or not, just unprofessional and giving Sydney a bad name for service. It's a sad, dark little place which a good pest clean and fresh coat of paint could really fix. We moved across the road into the Sir Stamford for the remainder of our stay - Clean! Light! Friendly! Quiet! Not much to ask for but the Savoy needs to sharpen up.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ojnab
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Savoy Hotel, although only 3.5 star rating it is a charming small hotel, the staff are so friendly and were always obliging to help with any queries we had. The buffet breakfast we had for $5 was great and you could have a cooked breakfast if needed for a few extra dollars. We do feel however that it may be best to book a superior room with window, the normal rooms did not seem to have this luxury and they appeared to be rather dark. We loved the tables and louges in the atrium, and the free coffee which is supplied all day in this area. Once again a very charming hotel in a very nice area.

Reviews.Title: “A great alternative to downtown Sydney”
Reviews.Author: GreenstoneGirl
Reviews.Content: We loved this little hotel in Double Bay, it is away from the hustle and bustle of the CBD and the suburb of Double Bay is pleasant clean and reasonably quiet. The best thing about the hotel was the staff-- they were so incredibly helpful-- even gave us an unused bus pass that a former guest left behind and answered all our questions, kept our luggage (no charge) while we went to the Hunter Valley, and offered lots of advice about sightseeing and restaurants. Rooms are small but adequate, showers/bath rooms are all newly upgraded with nice fixtures, and you can get breakfast in the hotel. Price is quite reasonalbe, we booked the internet special for $110 for 2 people with twin beds which was a real bargain! Double Bay is just 4 stops on the train from downtown, and the train station is a ten minute walk from the hotel (uphill mind you, dont plan on lugging your luggage up the hill) The buses stop just a block from the hotel and best of all its a short walk to the ferry terminal where you can catch a ferry to Circular Quay. Lots of restaurants that are reasonably priced, but shops are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmpireGal
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. Located on Double Bay, a suburb of Sydney. It's a 10 minute walk to the train station (up a pretty good hill) and a 5 minute walk to the ferry. We had a deluxe room, which was spotlessly clean, with a high ceiling, although not huge. Our third night there (unplanned) we had a standard room. These face an interior courtyard so have no windows, and are quite small, but again, spotlessly clean and with all the amenities. We found both room sizes perfectly adequate, as all we needed it for was to sleep. Double Bay is a very upscale section of Sydney, and has some beautiful architecture to look at, as well as boutique shopping and some great restaurants. It's about a 15 min train ride from the Circular Quay train station, which we found perfectly convenient. Located in the downstairs of this hotel is a small restaurant. It serves asian food for lunch and dinner, but is the location where the hotel offers their breakfast offerings in the mornings. Our room rate included a continental breakfast, and it was the best we had our entire visit. It was all you could eat cereals, breads, fresh fruits, juices, coffee and tea. For a small price ($5.50 AU) you could have a hot cooked breakfast. What really made this hotel special was the staff. They were wonderful. Very knowledgeable about Sydney and many other areas, even as far away as Cairns and Townsville. They were happy to let you check your e-mail in the evenings no charge (no web surfing though, and we didn't see an internet cafe anywhere nearby). We got advice on car rentals, traveling to the Blue Moutains - everything. I highly recommend this small hotel. It made a wonderful first impression of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel close to the city”
Reviews.Author: nwhow
Reviews.Content: It has been some time since I stayed there and as a fairly frequent traveller not many hotels stick in my mind but this one did. For a start we were travelling on a family holiday and booked one of the inter-connecting rooms. What struck us most was the enthusiastic and friendly nature of the receptionist, which seemed to apply to all the hotel staff and I really think that this is what makes a stay in any hotel memorable. Apart from this the hotel is in a great position (directly opposite the Stamford) and we really enjoyed the walks around Double Bay. Will definately be on my list when I am next in Sydney.

HotelInfo.Name: The Savoy Double Bay Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 41 - 45 Knox St | Double Bay, Sydney, New South Wales 2028, Australia
